intro: Athrixia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers, which are typically pea-like in shape, typical of the legume family. It is native to southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Athrixia stenophylla is adapted to arid environments and can thrive in full sun conditions.
